content:
24, 2016
												Chet Faliszek was right: You had no idea you wanted this, but you do. It's five dollars! If you ever spent 5 dollars on miniature golf, this is the better deal. It's a new showcase game for your friends, too! It's fun to just grab a planet and spin it around (thanks to the very good haptics in this game).Is is perfect? Nope. Is it overflowing with content? Nope. But it's one of the coolest concepts the Vive has. Two thumbs up.

number of helpful: 15 of 22 people (68%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
24, 2016
												This is how God would play golf. You chuck the ball across a planet's orbit to reach a hole on the other side of the planet or floating in space on a moon or asteroid. For $5 you get 18 holes, and each one is a unique planet with various different comic obstacles. You can finish the game in under an hour, but it'll take multiple playthroughs to actually get under par. Then there's "Pro Mode" where you get a much smaller indicator of the ball's arc. It also comes with achievements.Check out my gameplay video:


YouTube™ Video: Galaxy Golf: VR golf in space on a planetary scale with physics puzzles [HTC Vive gameplay] 

			Views: 1,458		

			Gameplay from Galaxy Golf, a VR physics puzzler where you play golf in the cosmos on the HTC Vive and Oculus Rift. Galaxy Golf lets you play golf on a planetary scale.

content:
24, 2016
												This is a neat little game. It has a few areas where I would like to see some aspects added, maybe a global scoreboard and multiplayer is always a plus. Aesthetically, the holes look very nice and the gameplay is really intuitive to figure out.I managed to get through both courses in about 45 minutes, granted I would need significantly more practice to reach par on even the easy course, but I hope they have one or two more courses planned and a few more nifty mechanics to keep it interesting. That said, I spent more for lunch today and I ate it faster than the time I put into this, so well worth the entertainment.

												Excellent puzzle game that could not take place outside of virtual reality. Even the VR cynics I've had try this game admit it: it's a blast to play through the challenging courses in this game. It also has shades of Super Mario Galaxy, which is a pleasant trip down memory lane.

content:
27, 2016
												Only my third returned game so far out of about 15.  The other 2 were Apollo 11 and Pool Nation.  This game was just extremely boring.  I believe all the excitement over this game was from months ago.  It really does not stand up to most games on the Vive right now.  You grab, you point to where you want it to go and then let go of the buttons.  You point and grab and let go over and over again.  It was not very involved at all.  The physics are great though.  But if you are looking for gameplay then look elsewhere.
